newsitem.title: USA: Advanced Materials sees '97 sales growth.
newsitem.headline: Advanced Materials sees '97 sales growth.

text.p: Advanced Materials Group said Monday that based on existing program orders and commitments, the company anticipates sales growth of between 35 percent and 40 percent for fiscal 1997.
Advanced Materials said it has shifted its marketplace strategy to place primary emphasis on the computer and related products niche.
The company said its operations in the fourth quarter ended November 30, 1996, showed strong results based on this shift in emphasis in terms of sales mix and gross margins.
Earlier the company reported a fourth quarter profit of $0.03 per share on sales of $6,049,000, compared with a year-earlier loss of $0.18 per share on sales of $3,090,000.

Advanced Materials said it believes the rising sales momentum and solid financial infrastructure it is bringing into fiscal 1997 will give it the means to capitalize on opportunities for enhancing shareholder value.
